item.title: Ask, Attend, Attack: An Effective Decision-Based Black-Box Targeted Attack for Image-to-Text Models
item.description: This paper introduces AAA, a novel three-stage decision-based black-box targeted attack against image-to-text models. AAA efficiently generates semantically consistent adversarial examples by asking …

item.title: Cross-Modality Perturbation Synergy Attack for Person Re-identification
item.description: Cross-Modality Perturbation Synergy (CMPS) attack: A novel universal perturbation method for cross-modality person re-identification, effectively misleading ReID models by leveraging gradients from di…

item.title: Federated Graph Learning for Cross-Domain Recommendation
item.description: FedGCDR, a novel federated graph learning framework, tackles cross-domain recommendation challenges by securely leveraging positive knowledge from multiple sources while mitigating negative transfer a…

item.title: I2EBench: A Comprehensive Benchmark for Instruction-based Image Editing
item.description: I2EBench: a new benchmark for Instruction-based Image Editing provides a comprehensive evaluation framework using 16 dimensions, aligned with human perception, to evaluate IIE models objectively.

item.title: The Dormant Neuron Phenomenon in Multi-Agent Reinforcement Learning Value Factorization
item.description: ReBorn revitalizes multi-agent reinforcement learning by tackling dormant neurons, boosting network expressivity and learning efficiency.

item.title: UniDSeg: Unified Cross-Domain 3D Semantic Segmentation via Visual Foundation Models Prior
item.description: UniDSeg uses Visual Foundation Models to create a unified framework for adaptable and generalizable cross-domain 3D semantic segmentation, achieving state-of-the-art results.
